page.title: 16ST PETER'S CHURCH,BROUGHTON
page.content: THE PRESENT INCUMBENT WORKS ON A ROTA BASIS,EACH CHURCH HAVING AT LEAST ONE SERVICE EACH SUNDAY.OVER THE MONTH ST. PETER'S HAS FAMILY COMMUNION 11AM,EVENSONG 6.30PM,HOLY COMMUNION 9.30AM,MATTINS 11AM.THE FONT IS RATHER ODD,BEING A CARVED RECESS IN ONE OF THE TOWER PIERS.IT HAS BEEN SUGGESTED THAT IT IS A PRE-REFORMATION HOLY WATER STOUP.THE PRESENT PRIEST HAS TO STAND ON A STOOL TO REACH IT WHEN BAPTIZING.THERE ARE VERY FEW BAPTISMS IN SUCH A SMALL PARISH,ONLY ONE IN 1984.THERE ARE VERY FEW WEDDINGS,NONE IN 1984;THE LAST ENTRIES ARE TWO YEARS APART.THERE WERE 3 BURIALS IN 1984.THE CHURCHYARD HAS MANY GRAVES OF PARISH FAMILIES AND A MEMORIAL TO THE FALLEN OF TWO WORLD WARS.WE HAVE A SMALL MOTHERS UNION BRANCH OF 12 MEMBERS.THERE IS A FINE PEAL OF 8 BELLS DATING FROM 1722 TO 1922.
